column2: "Oh... the Guardian. Thank you for your assistance the other day."
"Thank you for helping Lady Harriet."
"1. It was only natural."
"2. Is something wrong?"
"I simply regret that I could not have done as you had. That... I am not strong enough to do as you had."

"Please, do not think me to complain--I am grateful.
I am simply... remiss. I lack the strength to act as my position should."
"It is that lack of strength that has disallowed me to assist milady in her time of need."

"I am Lady Harriet's adjutant. Perhaps, if I had the
strength of a Guardian, she would rely on me more."
"You are not considering the use of Ephimera... Are you?"

"The reports I've heard speak of the intoxicating allure of its power.
Yet, much of its power and effects remain unknown."
"Nevertheless, you needn't even abstain from its effects, need you?"
"There are those, like myself, who are burdened by their lack of combat prowess and might, yet would never dream of using Ephimera."
"It would mean... betraying the ideals by which we stand behind milady."

"Ephimera is dangerous, and will drive the world into ruin.
It would be foolish to delude oneself into believing otherwise."
"Lady Harriet... has been fighting for everyone's sake. That... is irrefutable."
"To defeat Lutz, who has forsaken his own people in a mad lust for the power to achieve his own selfish desires..."
"...No matter the pain or terror in her way, she pushes through, and relentlessly forges on."
"I--No, everyone--is finding their own ways to offer their support."
"Guardian... Again, from the bottom of my heart, I thank you for helping Lady Harriet."
"But as her adjutant, it is my job to protect her!"
"If you will excuse me."
"He's so honest! He must really admire Harriet."
"Well, we successfully got some more information."
"Driven more by Harriet's inspiring spirit rather than solely to destroy the effects Ephimera's had on their lands, huh?"

"I'm quite charmed myself! Such dignity and poise...
She must have been raised by a wonderful family!
What do you think they're like?"
